page.title: 13Colwall Cricket Club
page.content: This was founded in approximately 1872 although it could go back even further according to some documents kept at Barton Court. It developed from a club which fielded mainly schoolmasters and clergymen to an organisation which involves a good cross-section of rural people. Around a third of the members come from the village whilst the rest travel from the Malvern/Upton/Ledbury area. The club boasts one of the finest village grounds in the country and is well-known for its high standard of play. In 1982 it reached the quarter-finals of the National Village Championship and won the Beach Villas Three Counties League. There are around 45 regular playing members, as well as youth sides. The committee is well-organised and effective.
